title: Monzo’s growing pains raise serious questions over its survival prospects
text:
By the time Monzo chief executive Tom Blomfield left hospital on crutches last week, the BBC had already filmed a Watchdog report criticising the digital bank.

The programme accused it of freezing accounts of some of its three million customers, occasionally for weeks without explanation, leaving a portion struggling to pay bills and buy food.

One mother told Watchdog: “It’s been really stressful because it’s put us into rent arrears; it’s actually put a bit of a strain on our relationship as well. How do you explain to a four-year-old that there’s no food in the house because of a bank?”

The next day, groggy on painkillers and recovering from surgery, Blomfield admitted that it had been a mistake...
